result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby R. Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Court Costs are paid in full from cash bond previously posted.  The remaining portion of the cash bond has been refunded to the poster.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby R. Lewis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 4:05 PM: Defendant Bobby R. Lewis in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  ADA argues as to cond'l jail request with 4 days TS credit.  Argument by SPD - argues for I/S jail.  Statement by Def: None offered. The Court:  S/W 3 yrs probation.  Conditions of Supervision:  90 days WCJ - I/S -  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; AODA and any follow thru; Court Costs plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court - bond to be applied - 60 DTP any Bal - may be PIF from bond.    Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Defendant to report to Wautoma DOC by the close of business tomorrow due to the late hour today.  4 days TS credit.  Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case called @ 2:36 p.m. Defendant Bobby R. Lewis in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.   NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video.

Case called @ 12:59 p.m. Defendant Bobby R. Lewis in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1200 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting signature bond. Court orders $1200 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
